content: Electoral ward in Singapore **Kallang Single Member Constituency** was a [single member constituency](/wiki/Single_Member_Constituency) (SMC) spanning [Kallang](/wiki/Kallang) of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It existed as **Kallang Constituency** from 1959 to 1988 then it was renamed as **Kallang Single Member Constituency** during political reform in 1988. The SMC lasted another term till 1991 when it was absorbed into [Jalan Besar Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Jalan_Besar_Group_Representation_Constituency). ## Member of Parliament YearMemberParty**Formation**[Legislative Assembly of Singapore](/wiki/Legislative_Assembly_of_Singapore)**1959**Buang bin Omar Junid[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1963**[Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore)**1968**[Abdul Aziz Karim](/wiki/Abdul_Aziz_Karim)[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1972****1976**[S. Dhanabalan](/wiki/S._Dhanabalan)**1980****1984****1988****Constituency abolished (1991)** ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1950s
title: Kallang Single Member Constituency
